page.title: 10SOUTHWICK MIXED FARM & WOODS
page.content: In our square are two farms owned by Southwick Estate. We had a conducted tour around Wanstead Farm. The landscape is pastoral. The ground is level and there are many trees. In the fields we saw cattle grazing. The main crop is grass. They also grow potatoes and maize. The farmland is intensively managed. The boundaries of the farm are marked by deciduous trees. In Great Belney Coppice there were some coniferous trees. There are only a few people working on the farm, the manager, his wife, two sons and five other farm workers. The sheep are Mashams from Cumbria. They have 150 ewes and 50 lambs, 55 or 60 piglets, 48 calves, one Guernsey,the rest all Friesians. The pigs are all Cotswold Pigs.
